column6: Interdisciplinary approach to the study of the aging process.
Exploration of basic research and theory on the psychological consequences of aging and psychological factors that affect the behavior of older persons.
Workshop setting dealing with a topic or topics in aging. Learning experiences are provided in a wide range of areas.
Discussion of a major topic within a specific field of gerontology.
Independent study in gerontology.

column2: PRACTICUM IN NURSING HOME ADMINISTRATION I
column4: human development and family studies (HDFS) majors and senior standing.
column6: Internship in nursing home care facility. One, 3 hour, on-campus seminar every three weeks (meets five times). Weekly one hour online lectures and discussions also take place. A minimum of 28 clock hours per week at internship site is required.

column2: PRACTICUM IN NURSING HOME ADMINISTRATION II
column4: human development and family studies (HDFS) major and senior standing.
column6: Internship in nursing home care facility. One, 3 hour, on-campus seminar every three weeks (meets five times). One hour online lectures and discussions are held each week. A minimum of 28 clock hours per week is required.

column4: Human development and family studies (HDFS) majors.
column6: Examines developmental processes across adulthood. Evaluation of theoretical models and scientific literature.

column2: SOCIAL POLICY AND COMMUNITY RESOURCES FOR OLDER ADULTS
column6: Overview of national, state and local public policy affecting older adults. Legislation, funding, planning and the service delivery system are examined.

column4: nursing (NURS), human development and family studies (HDFS), integrated life science (ILS) or integrated health science (IHS) majors; junior or senior standing.
column6: Presents an overview and introduction to the principles of long-term care (LTC) administration and other administration options.

column4: HDFS 44018; human development and family studies (HDFS) majors and senior standing. 3.000 OR
column6: (repeatable for a total of 6 credit hours.) Observation and participation in long-term care or community agencies serving older adults. One class discussion per week. Major GPA of 2.50 required.
Workshop setting dealing with a topic or topics in the field of gerontology.
Discussion of a major topic or topics within the field of gerontology.
Independent study in the area of gerontology.
Examines developmental processes across adulthood. Evaluation of theoretical models and scientific literature.
Presents an overview and introduction to the principles of long-term care (LTC) administration and other administration options.
Observation and participation in long-term care and community agencies serving older adults.
Seminar dealing with topics in the field of gerontology.

Course is designed to assist students in developing the knowledge and skills needed to understand the major issues in gerontological theory, research and practice from a multi-disciplinary perspective.

column2: FAMILY LIFE IN THE LATER YEARS
column6: Research on families in the later years is reviewed, with a particular emphasis on its utility to family life practitioners.
